metadata.title: CVE-2024-35992 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: phy:marvell: a3700-comphy: Fix out of bounds read There is an out of boundsread access of 'gbe_phy_init_fix[fix_idx].addr' every iteration after'fix_idx' reaches 'ARRAY_SIZE(gbe_phy_init_fix)'. Make sure'gbe_phy_init[addr]' is used when all elements of 'gbe_phy_init_fix' arrayare handled. Found by Linux Verification Center (linuxtesting.org) withSVACE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35992` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-39-generic - 6.8.0-39.39
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-39-generic - 6.8.0-39.39
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-39-generic-64k - 6.8.0-39.39
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1012-aws - 6.8.0-1012.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1012-azure - 6.8.0-1012.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1011-gcp - 6.8.0-1011.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gke - 6.8.0-1007.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1009-ibm - 6.8.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-39-lowlatency - 6.8.0-39.39.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-39-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-39.39.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oracle - 6.8.0-1010.10
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1008-raspi - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1009-oem - 6.8.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1008.15
No subscription required
